reviews.title: Wonderful bargain!
reviews.text: The Juliana Hotel is a wonderful hotel that I can't recommend enough. It was very affordable ($150 per night, which I booked on their website), very conveniently located, had oodles of charm, and our room was HUGE! I'm not sure if this was typical, but our room had a sofa bed. The lobby is very warm (with a working fireplace!) and hosts wine receptions or cocktail hours for free in the evening. The hotel even has a very small fitness room. The staff is pretty friendly, although not exactly bursting with knowledge about the city. You can't get a better value.

reviews.title: NIce experience!
reviews.text: Stayed there Feb. 13, 14, 2004. Very friendly and helpful staff. The facility is well kept and clean, and our standard room was what I would call medium size, with a respectable amount of furniture. If you are a light sleeper, I would ask for a room that is not on the Bush side, but otherwise the noise is typical of an urban downtown. Wine beside the fireplace in the evening was fun! I will definitely consider staying here again.

reviews.title: Great location, great price
reviews.text: I just got back from a short term trip to San Francisco...pleasantly surprised by the quality of the Juliana Hotel. The concierge was pleasant, the breakfast was adequate, and the location was fantastic. I did a little price shopping and ended up spending $72.50 a night there...excellent deal...the concierge commented on how good the rate was! Just search a little bit, because the Juliana will match any online price. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. I also like the Aveda products that they used...nice touch. I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Great Little Hotel
reviews.text: Delightful, small hotel. Well situated to spend the day sightseeing and the evenings attending the theater. Staff was helpful but seemed rushed most of the time. It was quiet, well appointed and comfortable. A non-alcoholic beverage would have added to the evening wine party for those of us who do not consume alcohol. But all in all, we were delighted with our stay.

reviews.title: Decent Hotel
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel. My girlfriend and I (both in our late 20's) just got back from a 4 day vacation in San Francisco. We are budget conscious travellers. This would be our first time to SF and knew that we wanted to do all the typical touristy things near/in downtown SF. We decided to stay in this hotel based upon the reviews on this website and the price (I got a standard room with a queen-sized bed for $130 CDN per night); I got this deal on expedia. This hotel seemed to offer the best location, ammenity, and price combination that I could find. I'm sure that there are better hotel deals out there, but location was a key for us. Also, we were warned by our friends that some areas of SF are quite questionable (there are some areas you definitely want to stay away from, especially if you are a single female traveller). As far as I am concerned, all the reviews about this hotel on this website up to this date are accurate.PROS:-great central location to see many tourist attractions in a pretty clean area of downtown. We ended up walking to most attractions. When something was too far, or we got tired of walking, we would just hop onto public transportation. The bus system is SF is excellent (cheap, clean, convenient, and I found the bus drivers to be very helpful and friendly). Most bus stops have maps so that you can decide what bus you need to take. The attractions we went to were: Fisherman's Wharf, Embarcadero, Alcatraz, Golden Gate Park, Chinatown, Pier 39, Lombard Street, Union Square, Financial district, SF Museum of Modern Art, SF Center and Metreon shopping centers, Fillmore and Unions street shops, Japantown, Fort Mason, Marina District, Ghiradelli Square, Exploratorium, Palace of the Legion of Honor, and the Palace of Fine Arts.-felt safe at this hotel location. The Ritz-Carlton is one block away, so you know it couldn't be that bad. I did see one or two panhandlers near our hotel, but they didn't bother us. They were not aggressive or abusive. Try not to book a hotel in the "TENDERLOIN" district because there are lots of panhandlers and homeless people around. This hotel is sufficiently removed from the "TENDERLOIN" district (the area bordered by Van Ness, Ellis, Mason, and Market Street).-friendly and helpful staff.-an appreciative cleaning staff. I left a $5 tip on the pillow every morning, and always came back to a thank-you note (let's just say I've never had cleaning staff leave me a thank-you note before). And they did a good job of cleaning too.-every morning, there was juice, coffee, muffins, and danishes available in the lobby. And every early evening, there is a complimentary wine tasting. We didn't take advantage of either because our agenda didn't allow for it. However, lots of other guests did.-The rooms look just like on the website. It was clean. More than adequate for travellers that just want a place to rest their heads at night.CONS:-room size was definitely adequate for the two of us. But for larger parties, the room would be too small (I'm sure that there must be larger rooms).-the hotel is a small boutique hotel, which means that it is a nicely decorated and quaint, but it is an older hotel. The problem with this is that the windows were old and did not do much to keep out the noise from outside. We had a room on the 2nd floor facing Stockton Street (side of the hotel). Let's just say that SF has a very active downtown core and in the early morning, the street sweepers and garbage trucks are out in full force. You can either try asking for a room higher up in the hotel and facing the alley (there isn't a view from the front or sides of the hotel anyways, so you won't be missing anything), or bring a pair of ear plugs (once you have ear plugs on, you won't notice a thing).-air conditioning unit is loud, but we didn't need to use it.-I can't explain it, but there were a couple of mosquitos in our room for a couple of the nights that we stayed. I ended up with 5 bites even though I thought I killed them all (but my girlfirend got away untouched). They must have gotten in when we opened the window in the bathroom to let the steam out.-no concierge service, but we didn't need it anyways. They were some helpful pamphlets and a very helpful map at the unattended concierge desk.-the carpet on the stairs was worn, but it's not like it affected our enjoyment.SF TIPS:-If you are doing things in downtown SF, then this is a good hotel to be staying at. However, if you are doing things outside of downtown SF (i.e. NAPA Valley, Sausalito, Monterey), then you mind as well stay at a cheaper hotel outside of town and rent a car (parking is expensive in downtown SF; around $20 US a day).-We saved a bundle on transportation by walking or taking the bus when we needed to. The bus only costs $1.25 US and is good for 1.5hrs unlimited travel in one direction. The "BART" subway takes you between the airport and downtown SF for only $4.70 US/per person, one way. The ride in from/out to the airport is convenient, safe, and is 15 minutes faster than a cab, and $40 cheaper. The BART is only 5 blocks away from the hotel (Powell Street station).

reviews.title: Great Deal
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Juliana hotel. We paid $106 per night and the room was not huge but it was plenty of space for 2 people...esp. if you don't spend a lot of time there. Nicely decorated and very clean.The breakfast consisted of muffins, danish, juice and coffee and was a nice addition.The wine reception in the afternoon was also a nice treat. Each evening there were also fresh baked cookies at the front desk.The hotel is in a great location and very safe. It's in walking distance to Nob Hill, Chinatown, North Beach and Union Square. Also, the cable car line runs 1 block away.Only recommendation is to ask for a room in the back as we were on the Bush street side on the 4th floor and it was very noisy during sporadic times at night and in the morning. The view from the front isn't that great anyway...a parking garage and Stockton Street. Also, ask for a higher floor.Rooms were very clean and the staff was friendly, but not bursting with knowledge or offering recommendations as someone else mentioned.Overall a great deal for San Francisco.

reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay at the Juliana Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Juliana Hotel for 4 nights in Aug. 2003. Although we did not have a view, our deluxe room was very spacious and tastefully decorated. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and wine reception.

reviews.title: Juliana is best hotel for the $$
reviews.text: The staff was very nice. We felt safe in the hotel and in the neighborhood.

reviews.title: Next to China Towne
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Juliana during the Summer of 2003 and absolutely loved it! We find the location to be very convenient to Union Square and cable car stop to Fishmermen's Wharf.

reviews.title: you might as well stay in a playhouse
reviews.text: The look is very "trendy/boutiquey," which is great if you're accustomed to corporate suites. Highly recommend it---plus it's a great value.

reviews.title: We'll be back
reviews.text: Book on-line for a really good deal. Room was small but perfect for 2 guests. Room smelled of cigarette smoke. Had to open window all night to air out room. Maid service was excellent. The bathroom was very clean. 3 minute walk to the Powell cable car. 30 second walk to China Towne Gate. Wierd tidbit-the closet was bigger than the bathroon (the bathroom was big)...what a waste of space. Easy valet, loading, unloading of car. Very quiet. AC was old and loud-stuck cotton balls inside to shut it up. Each room has fold out iron board. Leave shampoo at home...Hotel Juliana provides good Aveda shampoo.

Know what? All the other reviews were right on! This hotel is a great find - very comfortable accommodations, unbeatable location, reasonable price. I stayed for 3 nights at the end of June and I was extremely satisfied.
reviews.title: Met all my expectations
GREAT LOCATION, GREAT PRICE
reviews.text: The Bush/Stockton St. location is prime - 1 block from Powell-Hyde or Powell-Mason and 2 blocks from Calif. cable lines. 2 blocks up from Union Sq. and 1 street over from Chinatown gates. Stockton St. is on the route of several major MUNI bus lines - 30, 45. Compared to other trendy hotels, Juliana is in a much safer area than those on Geary St. (Savoy, Monaco, Diva et al).

reviews.title: Nice for the Price
reviews.text: Loved all the complimentary services, incl. the Aveda toiletries, cont'l breakfast (not fancy, not quality, but it nicely compensated for a lack of a hotel restaurant), the bowl of apples, the wine reception, the towncar service to fin'l district.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!
reviews.text: For better breakfast fare, walk 1 block to Grant St. to get something at Second Cup or Cafe de la Presse. Or as another reviewer mentioned, the Roxanne rest. on Powell St. is 1 block in the other direction.

reviews.title: Great Bargain - Very Cute Hotel Rooms
reviews.text: My room on the 4th flr was well-decorated and spacious. Lots of walking space even though it included a double bed, 2 night tables, a desk/chair, sofa, armchair, round corner table, TV cabinet. Bathroom was large, clean and bright. Great water pressure, too. Bed was plump with a mattress pad and I had more down pillows than I needed.
